_header: Most prudent prince of proved prevision
Subjects: York; Henry VII; occasional verse; historical verse
_description: Address of Welcome to Henry VII at York (1486) at Ouse Bridge — in rhyme royal stanzas

YorkCity6.First Lines:
Most prudent prince of pruved previsionTheir premordiall princes of
                    this principalitie…
YorkCity6.Last Lines:
…Ye be avisid most worthi by graciouse affluenceSubmitting to
                    your sufferaunt my septour of sapience
YorkCity6.Note:
Three stanzas; ‘Salomon’ at top of f.
                    16v.
YorkCity6.Editions:

BLCottJulBXII.First Lines:
Moost prudent prynce of provid previsionTher primordiall princes of
                    this principalitie…
BLCottJulBXII.Last Lines:
…Of purede witt to your blood of great antiquitieThis your
                    citie Is solacede to haue your soueraigntie
BLCottJulBXII.Note:
‘Salamon’ written in the right margin (f. 11). Folio number
                    reflects the most recent foliation.

Smith,  A. H.
